basics.name: Bhoj Rani Soopal
basics.label: Data Engineer
basics.summary: Versatile data engineer with expertise in pipeline design and data visualization, eager to apply technical acumen to software engineering for product development.

work.summary: Developed a BI tool, Apache Superset, hosted in AWS Lightsail for tracking KPIs for operations, finance, and marketing.
highlights: ETLed data from various sources, including API and database.
Utilized SQL to create dashboards for stakeholders including Managers and Executive members.
Modeled Google’s Speech Recognition phone call API with in-house candidate-headhunter conversation.
Implemented Hugging Face API to summarize candidate-headhunter conversation in French, increasing headhunter productivity.

work.summary: Wrote different Python scripts accessing Zendesk, Finra, and marketing data at M1 to automate the ingestion process in AWS S3 and Redshift.
highlights: Translated 10 different cron jobs to automated workflow using Apache Airflow and shell scripting.
Prepared SQL queries for profiling semi-structured data in phone number data of M1’s client.
Improved data quality of phone number data.

work.summary: Developed predictive models to analyze hardware failure utilizing the open-source Backblaze dataset.
highlights: Employed scikit-learn libraries for XGBoost and Random Forest supervised learning algorithms.
Utilized Plotly for crafting visual confusion matrix displays.
Initiated and chaired productive meetings with fellow data scientists to refine project proposals.

projects.name: Ugly Christmas Sweater
projects.description: Developed Streamlit Web App for User text input to train on a personality dataset that was processed and fed in the Keras LSTM model to predict a multi-category classification of 16 unique personality codes.
highlights: Used Cohere API, Keras, and Streamlit Cloud

projects.name: Software Engineering Mentor
projects.description: Trained 2 mentees with web applications and guided them with multiple code reviews, monitored their progress and adjusted the training based on their needs.

projects.name: Airline Data Analysis
projects.description: Analyzed US domestic flights dataset using pyspark dataframes and predicted which flight carrier is most likely to delay or cancel.
highlights: Tools: AWS EMR Cluster, Zeppelin Notebook, Spark, S3 buckets
